benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to bundle

covered: Valid Request: Numerous TC scenarios validate successful modification with required headers and valid body (TC01, TC02).
Non-Existing Resource: Scenario TC05 covers 404 when bundle not found.
Invalid Input/Error Handling: Scenarios for invalid bundleId (TC04), missing header (TC06), malformed body (TC07), missing body (TC08), extra/unsupported fields (TC09).
Authorization: Unauthorized access scenario (TC10) and required header presence (TC06).
Server/Dependency Failures: System error (TC11) and integration inconsistency (TC20).
Data Validation: SQL injection test (TC12) and edge cases (TC13, TC14, TC15).
Partial and State Variations: Partial update test (TC24), state variations (TC22, TC23, TC25).
Performance/Load: Normal and peak load tests (TC17, TC18).
Security: Special characters in values (TC12, TC19).
Recovery from transient failures: Retry scenario (TC21).
gaps: Authorization: While TC10 covers unauthorized access, there are no explicit tests for forbidden access (403) or token expiry scenarios.
Concurrency/Race Conditions: No tests explicitly cover concurrent updates to the same bundle custom fields (race conditions).
Caching Behavior: No tests assert caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or rate limiting.
Pagination: Not applicable for PUT on a single resource, but guidelines mention handling large datasets; covered via max fields but not a pagination scenario.
Advanced validation: While several input validation cases exist, explicit duplicate submission handling (idempotency) is not separately tested.
recommendations: Add a test for forbidden access (403) to complement 401 unauthorized test.
Introduce concurrency/race-condition scenarios to verify safe concurrent updates to the same bundle.
Add tests validating caching behavior (ETag, Cache-Control) for PUT responses when applicable.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure system resilience under bursts of PUT requests.
If pagination is relevant to related GET/list endpoints, add pagination tests there; for PUT, consider testing idempotency/concurrency controls (e.g., concurrent identical requests).
Consider explicit duplicate submission handling or idempotency checks for PUT requests to ensure safe retries.
